X.ii.1.B.2.f
.
Effect of  Return to Active Duty on Protection Under 38 CFR 3.957
Protection under
38 CFR 3.957
does not require continuous SC status.  Consider the total time the disability has been SC when determining whether the 10 year criteria under
38 CFR 3.957
have been met.
Example
:  SC for a disability has been in effect for four years.  Subsequently, the Veteran returned to active duty for six years.  Benefits were reinstated the day following discharge.  The claim is reviewed eight years after benefits were reinstated, and evidence now indicates severance of SC is warranted for the disability.  Severance
may not
be undertaken because SC has been in effect for 10 years or more.  SC for the Veteran’s disability is protected under
38 CFR 3.957
based on the four years prior to return to active duty plus an additional eight years following the release from that period of active duty, totaling more than ten years.
